title: Legal Ways to Pay Your Kids Tax-Free Income: What You Need to Know
subtitle: Discover how families can utilize tax deductions to provide tax-free income to their children while ensuring compliance with the law.
content:
Question: Dad, could you tell me something that seems illegal, but isn't?

Dad: Absolutely! Each year, I pay your 7-year-old brother $18,000 of tax-free income to work for me.

Question: Uh, Dad, that is illegal?

Dad: No, it's taking advantage of small business deductions.

Question: What's the catch?

Dad: The job has to be safe, he has to be paid fairly, and it has to be appropriate for his age.

Question: I thought the tax-free limit was $12,000 per child.

Dad: It is, but I put an additional $6,000 into an IRA for him.

Question: And he gets $18,000 tax-free?

Dad: Yup. And you get an $18,000 small business deduction?

Dad: Yup. Keeping it in the family. That's why it pays to know the tax code, son.
